qas.question: What catholic document compares the Catholic church to the body of Christ?
What document declares that the Roman Catholic church lives within the body of Christ?
What was being celebrated in the Catholic calendar when the Eccelsiam suam was given in 1964?
On what date is the Feat of Transfiguration celebrated?
In what city  is the cathedral of St Peter's  located?

context: <a0_0>Ecclesiam suam<a0_0/> was given at St. Peter's, <a4_0>Rome<a4_0/>, on the <a2_0>Feast of the Transfiguration<a2_0/>, <a3_0>6 August<a3_0/> 1964, the second year of his Pontificate. It is considered an important document, identifying the Catholic Church with the Body of Christ. A later Council document <a1_0>Lumen Gentium<a1_0/> stated that the Church subsists in the Body of Christ, raising questions as to the difference between "is" and "subsists in". Paul VI appealed to "all people of good will" and discussed necessary dialogues within the Church and between the Churches and with atheism.
